title: Suggestions to compliment these objects?
content:
![](http://web.archive.org/web/20140720183603im_/http:/typophile.com/files/goingCrazy_3537.jpg)
  
I am developing a tech brand and one of the primary elements are these blocks (one not shown will be the logo), but I'm having a really hard time finding a typeface to compliment them. I explored many san sarifs and even threw Didot in just to see... to no avail. I am at a loss, frankly.

I did make some headway by not using heavy weights. Throwing in a light Dicot (not sure where this came from... can't find info on origins). But I feel like the swell? fillet? (the round corners) aren't doing me any favors.
author: theplatypus

comments.content:
[http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/fontfont/ff-primary/](http://web.archive.org/web/20140720183603/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/fontfont/ff-primary/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/fontfont/ff-primary/")  
 [http://typographica.org/typeface-reviews/macula/](http://web.archive.org/web/20140720183603/http:/typographica.org/typeface-reviews/macula/ "http://typographica.org/typeface-reviews/macula/")  
 [http://typographica.org/typeface-reviews/axia/](http://web.archive.org/web/20140720183603/http:/typographica.org/typeface-reviews/axia/ "http://typographica.org/typeface-reviews/axia/")

But: How much text do you need to deliver?

hhp

Not too much: name of company, and typical stationary system.  
A secondary typeface for body will be selected/suggested according to the logo.

oooh... Axia, how you swoon me. Thank you for the suggestions. I'll plug it in a see how things shake out. I see what you're looking for visually and I'll attempt to find similar styles. You're experience is humbling.

Eboy or Minimum might make a good accompanying wordmark.

[http://www.fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/fontfont/ff\_eboy\_ot/](http://web.archive.org/web/20140720183603/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/fontfont/ff_eboy_ot/ "http://www.fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/fontfont/ff\_eboy\_ot/")  
 [http://www.fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/fontfont/ff\_minimum\_ot/](http://web.archive.org/web/20140720183603/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/fontfont/ff_minimum_ot/ "http://www.fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/fontfont/ff\_minimum\_ot/")

Depending on how obviously techy you want to be, monospace or monospace-looking faces might be useful.
Eboy Beta intriques me. I like that the "i" retains small-cap. Thank you for sharing Nick.
